intro: Hesperelaea palmeri, commonly known as the Palmer's hesperelaea, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its showy yellow to orange composite flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils in arid environments. It has narrow, linear leaves and produces small, daisy-like blooms. Hesperelaea palmeri is adapted to withstand drought conditions and is often found in desert ecosystems.
